intro: Cluytiandra somalensis, commonly known as the Somali cluytiandra, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
